summary.para: The CRYPT_RETRIEVE_AUX_INFO structure contains optional information to pass to the function. All unused members of this structure must contain zero.
The size, in bytes, of the structure.
A structure that contains the time of the last synchronization of the data retrieved.
A value that specifies a limit to the number of bytes retrieved. A value of zero or less specifies no limit.
A pointer to a structure. To get prefetch information, set its cbSize upon input. For no prefetch information, except for cbSize, the data structure contains zero upon return.
A pointer to a structure. To get flush information, set its cbSize upon input. For no flush information, except for cbSize, the data structure contains zero upon return.

A pointer to a structure. To get response information, set the pointer to the address of a CRYPTNET_URL_CACHE_RESPONSE_INFO pointer updated with the allocated structure. For no response information, ppResponseInfo is set to NULL. If it is not NULL, it must be freed by using the function.
A pointer to a string that contains a prefix for a cached file name. If not NULL, the specified prefix string is concatenated to the front of the cached file name.

A pointer to a structure that specifies a cache synchronization time. If not NULL, any information cached before this time is considered time invalid. For a CRYPT_CACHE_ONLY_RETRIEVAL, if there is a cached entry before this time, returns ERROR_INVALID_TIME. When used with an HTTP retrieval, this specifies the maximum age for a time-valid object.

A value that indicates whether was called with CRYPT_PROXY_CACHE_RETRIEVAL set in dwRetrievalFlags and a proxy cache was not explicitly bypassed for the retrieval. This flag is not explicitly cleared and only applies to HTTP URL retrievals.

A value that specifies a status code from an unsuccessful HTTP response header. If CRYPT_NOT_MODIFIED_RETRIEVAL was set in dwRetrievalFlags, and the HTTP retrieval returns HTTP_STATUS_NOT_MODIFIED, this contains the HTTP_STATUS_NOT_MODIFIED status code. This value is not explicitly cleared and is only updated for HTTP or HTTPS URL retrievals.
